definition: handsome/refined/elegant/graceful/superior/show (loanword)/CL:場|场[chang2]/(literary) to grow/to bloom/(of crops) to produce ears
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: EVA mousepad is delicate and fragile , outward appearance is delicate , economy is pragmatic.
sentences.chinese: EVA鼠標墊小巧玲瓏，外觀秀氣，又經濟實用。

sentences.english: She could peel an apple in one long girlie strip.
sentences.chinese: 她能把蘋果皮削成長長秀氣的一條。

sentences.english: My desk-mate is a pretty girl.
sentences.chinese: 我的同桌是一個秀氣的小姑娘。

sentences.english: As a young woman, she was nice-looking, tidy and elegant.
sentences.chinese: 這是一位長得很好看的女老師，年輕秀氣，整潔大方。

sentences.english: A small dainty foot or one down at the pastern are not functional.
sentences.chinese: 小而秀氣的腳或者彎曲過大的踝部是沒有功能的。

sentences.english: she is slim and beautiful, and always has a nice smile on her face.
sentences.chinese: 她身材苗條，長得秀氣，臉上總掛着燦爛的笑容。

sentences.english: A small dainty foot or one down at the pastern are not functional.
sentences.chinese: 小而秀氣的腳恐怕屈曲過大的踝部是沒有用力的。

sentences.english: Delicate snakes south of the Yangtze River is a gentle quiet of .
sentences.chinese: 秀氣的江南是一位婀娜多姿，溫柔嫺靜的小家碧玉。

definition: lucid and elegant/quiet and exquisite/clear and attractive style
mellow and full/suave/smooth and round/rich (in voice)
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
